translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise in Pairs🔽With Root Cause

original: Sahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Sahetukaṁ dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca naahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Sahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasahetuko
analyzed: sa hetukam dhammam paṭicca na sa hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā sa hetukam dhamma  paṭicca na ahetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā sa hetukam dhammam paṭicca na sa hetukaḥ
translated: With root cause as condition, a state without root cause arises. With root cause as condition,🔽a state with root cause arises. With root cause as condition, a state without root cause and a state with root cause arise.🔽With root cause as condition, a state without root cause arises. With root cause as condition,

original: ca naahetuko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Ahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Ahetukaṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: ca na ahetukaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā  ahetukam dhammam paṭicca na ahetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā ahetukam dhamma
translated: a state with root cause arises. With root cause as condition, a state without root cause and a state with root cause arise.

original: paṭicca nasahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Ahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasahetuko🔽ca naahetuko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: paṭicca na sa hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā ahetukam dhammam paṭicca na sa hetukaḥ  ca na ahetukaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: With root cause as condition, a state with root cause arises. With root cause as condition,

original: Sahetukañca ahetukañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nasahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Sahetukañca🔽ahetukañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Sahetukañca ahetukañca
analyzed: sa hetukam ca ahetukañca dhammam paṭicca na sa hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā sa hetukañca 🔽ahetukañca dhammam paṭicca na ahetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā sa hetukam ca ahetukañca
translated: a state without root cause arises. With root cause as condition, a state with root cause and a state without root cause arise.

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca nasahetuko ca naahetuko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca na sahetuko ca na ahetuko ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: and from a state that is neither causally-related to nor causally-unrelated to a state that is neither causally-related to nor causally-unrelated to it arise causally. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe cha, adhipatiyā pañca …pe… avigate nava. (Sahajātavārampi …pe… pañhāvārampi vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe cha adhipatiyā pañca pe avigate nava sahajāta vārampi pe pañhā vārampi vitthāretabba
translated: In the case of cause, there are nine; in the case of object, there are six; in the case of predominance, there are five. … In the case of dissociation, there are nine. (The section on the origination of the faculties should be elaborated in the same way as the section on the origination of the aggregates, etc., in the chapter on the exposition of conditions.)
